Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This class is essentially where the entire environment of the game is as it holds and has access to most of the very important variables and other classes. As a result, this class contains most of the very important methods

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Game()
    This is where the game is set up when the user runs it A new world is created starting at level 1 and it is populated The GUI is set up for the user to interact with at the bottom of the screen The controller is also set up for the user to be able to control the player

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void battleLost()
    When the player lost the battle, the player gets removed from the world and the player loses control over the player
    void battleStart​(Player player, Character enemy, CharacterBattle enemyStats, city.cs.engine.World battleWorld)
    This method runs every time a battle is about to start It sets the view into the battle world and pauses the current level to ensure nothing in the level world occurs during the fight.
    void battleWon()
    The method for when the player has defeated an enemy.
    boolean getBattle()  
    city.cs.engine.World getBattleWorld()  
    int getENEMY_KILLED()  
    javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()  
    int getLevel()  
    Player getPlayer()  
    PlayerBattle getPlayerStats()  
    city.cs.engine.World getWorld()  
    void goNextLevel()
    This method places the player into the next level It checks what level the player is currently in If the player is in the last level then the game ends If the player is in any other level then the player is placed in the next level with the next level needing to be populated, the controller being set on the new body od that level and the view being set to that level With all that the level can start
    void goToLevel​(GameLevel currentLevel, int ENEMY_KILLED)
    This method runs every time the user loads or resets the game It essentially works the same as the method of going to the next level except it uses the level that it has received as a parameter and it doesn't need to check what level the player is currently in It also receives the number of enemies killed in that level so that it can be used to deduct the number of enemies in that level when the level is loaded This prevents enemies from being respawned after being defeated
    boolean isCurrentLevelCompleted()  
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      This is where the game is set up when the user runs it A new world is created starting at level 1 and it is populated The GUI is set up for the user to interact with at the bottom of the screen The controller is also set up for the user to be able to control the player

  • Method Details

    • getFrame

      public javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
      Returns:
      contains the GUI buttons and the view of the current world. It is the window

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns:
      The player in the current level world

    • getWorld

      public city.cs.engine.World getWorld()
      Returns:
      The current world

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Returns:
      The current level number

    • isCurrentLevelCompleted

      public boolean isCurrentLevelCompleted()
      Returns:
      Whether or not the requirements have been met for the player to proceed to the next level

    • goNextLevel

      public void goNextLevel()
      This method places the player into the next level It checks what level the player is currently in If the player is in the last level then the game ends If the player is in any other level then the player is placed in the next level with the next level needing to be populated, the controller being set on the new body od that level and the view being set to that level With all that the level can start

    • goToLevel

      public void goToLevel​(GameLevel currentLevel, int ENEMY_KILLED)
      This method runs every time the user loads or resets the game It essentially works the same as the method of going to the next level except it uses the level that it has received as a parameter and it doesn't need to check what level the player is currently in It also receives the number of enemies killed in that level so that it can be used to deduct the number of enemies in that level when the level is loaded This prevents enemies from being respawned after being defeated
      Parameters:
      currentLevel - The level the game is going to load to
      ENEMY_KILLED - The number of enemies that must be removed from that level

    • battleStart

      public void battleStart​(Player player, Character enemy, CharacterBattle enemyStats, city.cs.engine.World battleWorld)
      This method runs every time a battle is about to start It sets the view into the battle world and pauses the current level to ensure nothing in the level world occurs during the fight. The battle controller is set to the player
      Parameters:
      player - The player body for the battle world
      enemy - The enemy body for the battle world
      enemyStats - The enemy's stats
      battleWorld - The battle world itself

    • getBattleWorld

      public city.cs.engine.World getBattleWorld()
      Returns:
      the current battle world the player is in

    • battleWon

      public void battleWon()
      The method for when the player has defeated an enemy. The player's health is restored, the view is set back to the level world and the controller is given to the player again and the level resumes from where the player left off with the enemy now gone

    • battleLost

      public void battleLost()
      When the player lost the battle, the player gets removed from the world and the player loses control over the player

    • getBattle

      public boolean getBattle()
      Returns:
      whether or not the player is currently in a battle

    • getENEMY_KILLED

      public int getENEMY_KILLED()
      Returns:
      the number of enemies the player has defeated in that world

    • getPlayerStats

      public PlayerBattle getPlayerStats()
      Returns:
      The player's stats

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Parameters:
      args - The main method
